text:
Synopsis
Corporate interest in Bitcoin is emerging as a significant trend, with major companies and financial institutions increasingly exploring cryptocurrency investments and integration.

Key Insights
- Sony launched a blockchain platform (Soneium) on mainnet, targeting content creators, but faced controversy over memecoin restrictions
- Bitwise CIO Matt Hougan predicts hundreds of companies will buy Bitcoin for their treasuries in the next 12-18 months
- 70 publicly traded companies now own Bitcoin, including Coinbase, Block, Tesla, and SpaceX
- Italy's largest bank, Intesa Sanpaolo, purchased 11 BTC (worth over $1 million) as an "experiment"
- Bank of England plans to launch a "Digital Pound Lab" in 2025 to explore central bank digital currency innovations
- Analysts suggest Trump's inauguration may not trigger the expected Bitcoin sell-off, with reduced market momentum
